page.title: 17HONEST FRUIT PICKERS
page.content: June and July is a busy time in the soft fruit growing farms around Solihull. Many local farms rely on the pick-your-own trade. At Woodhouse farm Catherine de Barnes, a 'sin-bin' has been placed near the cash desk where visitors are encouraged to make a donation if they have eaten any of the crop while picking. In recent years the idea has raised hundreds of pounds for Warren Pearl House, a home for the elderly, in Solihull town centre. In 1984 Â£360 was raised in this way. Pick-your-own visitors have come to expect this routine as they pay for their strawberries.
